website_summaries.verdict: Fairly sturdy for its low price point, but its finicky scanner can be frustrating.
pros: Pairs almost seamlessly with most devices, including Macs
Lightweight but sturdy, holding up to frequent use
cons: Finding the right distance and angle to scan can be tricky
Doesn’t pick up small-sized bar codes, glossy bar code labels, or colored codes very well
Data cable can fail after several weeks of heavy use

customer_reviews.title: While it seemed to scan large bar codes just fine, it wouldn't pick up smaller ones
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner to do inventory of thousands of smaller items. While it seemed to scan large bar codes just fine, it wouldn't pick up smaller ones. I'm talking about jewelry store sized tags - won't do it. So while it would be fine for larger codes, it is useless to me. Edit: I hate when people leave bad reviews when there are circumstances in which the product performs well. Because of this, I am changing my review from 1 star to 3 stars. On our larger shipping boxes it works well, it just doesn't work for jewelry price tag sizes bar codes.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for my use
customer_reviews.text: I read through several reviews for a few barcode scanners and decided to purchase the WN3300 because of the good reviews and value. I'm using the scanner for several home projects where scanning item barcodes was a central element. The scanner needed to be versatile and work with my PC and Android tablet. The WN3300 works in all accounts and my projects have been moving forward. Due to my clumsiness I damaged a component and emailed tech support. They responded in a timely manner and arranged for me to obtain the part I damaged. In addition to great components there is also great service supporting the customer. Totally satisfied with WN3300 and the support.
customer_reviews.author: Copykat

customer_reviews.title: Not Rubber Coated just plastic
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use USB plugged bar code scanner it has many features like scanning multiple bar code types and changing the CRLF pre and post number characters the only thing I didn't like about it is that it is too light and the plastic is hard and looks like it is low quality plastic. I thought it will have some rubber casing in case it falls (and it happens a lot) but no it is all cheap hard plastic. Won't survive long where we work so I'm going to return it and look for another one rubber coated.
customer_reviews.author: Fadi

customer_reviews.title: Do you like spending $ on junk?  Then buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a day and a half. Then the light wouldn't turn on so it couldn't scan. This was my first and last time trying out this brand. I'm a librarian who handles over 20,000 circulations a year. I need a quality bar code scanner that works reliably. I will give the company credit for quickly refunding my money once I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica White

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Works Great !
customer_reviews.text: Plug and Play, no drivers needed. Just plug it into a USB port and start scanning. Scans into an Outlook email, Excel spreadsheet, Notepad, Word, even a field on a web page. Perfect for what I need it for, and the price is unbeatable - a third of the price of other hand scanners I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: JPR

customer_reviews.title: Aim and scan
customer_reviews.text: This product is a simple barcode scanner for a reasonable price. When you plug it in the computer will recognize it for its purpose e.g. If you plug it in and open a notepad or any text program simply scan a barcode and the code will print to the text software as if you typed it in with a keyboard. This scanner should be compatible with any inventory software. It serves its purpose for me as I use it with Microsoft excel. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: PhilatLVanORLanNY

customer_reviews.title: No instructions for ISBN book codes.
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: When used right out of the box, will not interpret ISBN type codes used for books correctly. The included manual does not specifically tell how to use codes printed in the manual to recalibrate the scanner to read ISBN codes. Like: The scanner does an excellent job reading UPC codes commonly used on merchandise. Re my Dislike: If anyone uses this scanner for ISBN book codes, please reply with detailed instructions, an Internet link, or an email address so that we can correspond. Thank you, Will Littlejohn
customer_reviews.author: wlittlej

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play with Ubuntu 18.04
customer_reviews.text: This little zapper worked out of the box without additional drivers on Ubuntu Linux 18.04 LTS--and can read in barcodes from all sorts of products. I'm new to bar codes, so I have little to compare--but my initial testing was completely positive with no bugs found. I posted this to make note of basic compatibility with input into Linux OS.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Darsow

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner with great results.
customer_reviews.text: I install a product in global locations and I bring this scanner with me. The scanner is lightweight and no drivers were required on a Macbook running Sierra. It scans easily and it not only beeps but it stops scanning when the barcode is read preventing double entries. Squeezing the trigger switch again restarts the scanner for the next barcode. I scan barcodes directly into spreadsheets and when a code is scanned it is immediately followed by a carriage return. A programming sheet is included if you want to play with the features.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Suarez

customer_reviews.title: same but with the stand for same price and so far it’s been like 2 weeks and it’s working fine
customer_reviews.text: Laser stopped working after 2 months, but I think it already came broke.... something was wrong with it. Laser wast shipping up sometimes from the begging. But I go another one, same but with the stand for same price and so far it’s been like 2 weeks and it’s working fine .
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Fast, accurate and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: They always work well, with no setup for Mac & Windows in 'keyboard wedge' mode, with zero configuration. Great for quick data entry in MS Excel, or other POS application. Scans code28 & 3of9 instantly, with multi-colored light feedback and a clear laser line. I've ordered dozens of these over the years for customers to use for fast data entry, and I've always been satisfied. Along the way have been tempted by several other low-end scanners -- a few dollars less (or comparably priced with wireless features) -- but the quality of those couldn't compare. I've only once had to replace one of these "in the field", so they stand up fairly well to long-term use.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: This scanner was purchased to catalogue items here in my media collection. My big complaint is the inability to turn off the beeping. It’s annoying to hear over and over if you need to scan large numbers of items.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D

customer_reviews.title: Some of the barcodes are hard to scan. Not as accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Having trouble with some barcodes. It scan sometimes but not the other. Tried reset and reprogram. Still the same. Seems like a laser issue. Should invest for more on scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Leong

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I'd normally give this 5 stars for being cheap, functional, and easy to use, but this scanner doesn't work particularly well on anything that is grey or silver. Some barcodes on a metallic sticker don't read. I know that's due to the sticker being reflective but it still is kind of a pain. Also the beep is LOUD even at it's lower settings. That's fairly minor though. I'd give this 4.5 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Does not read barcode well. Finally not working.
customer_reviews.text: It does not read barcode well. I have to shoot the laser from many different angle for it to read. Very inconsistent. I do not recommend. Update. The scanner finally stopped working. It never worked well. I would have to move the scanner around a lot for it to read. But now it is not reading at all. Very poor quality product. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Moon

customer_reviews.title: Won Nice USB Laser Scan Barcode Scanner Bar
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 different Won Nice lasers and neither one worked.I took my computer to a computer expert to see if it was a problem with my computer but the computer was working perfectly. The person tried the scanner on 5 different computers and it did not work on any of them, I realize the item is inexpensive but it did not work. I was definately disapointed as I needed one fast. I would not buy again. Steve Prince.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Prince

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what’s wrong with this thing
customer_reviews.text: A little cheap plastic feel but it works great for the price! Update: After only four days it won’t read barcodes anymore. Will be but will not pick up the barcode.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Light enough for travel and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I provide training for libraries, and I use barcodes all the time. I wanted something I could travel with. This is light enough to stick in my bag. I haven't had any trouble scanning Codabar standard, Code39, etc. I've even been able to just plug and play with clients' computers with no trouble. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FBinFL

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent - fast and accurate!
customer_reviews.text: This reader is very cheap but not cheaply made. The connectors and handle are nice a strong so we should get years of use. Easy to configure, just hang on the the little booklet that comes with it so you can change settings. No software required. About to pick up a second one so the can price faster.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Coots

customer_reviews.title: Probably works BUT...
customer_reviews.text: There is no manual for this scanner so forget trying to program it if that is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Well functioning bar code scanner
customer_reviews.text: Scanner was purchased to input serial numbers from computer hardware. Some of the labels on the hardware we use are tiny (<1/4") but we had no problems once the best angle was identified. It did have trouble with lightly printed bar codes. The device was plug-and-play with my laptop. I wish it also scanned QR codes, but I'm not subtracting any stars for that, since it's clear from the item's product description that this isn't a feature.
customer_reviews.author: Harper

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent scanner for light to medium use. There are times when you have to try multiple times to have it recognize and read a bar code, so I would not recommend it for someone who will be using it a lot, as I can see that being frustrating. That being said, for occasional use, it is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: MajorDrake

customer_reviews.title: Great basic barcode scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my work place as we scan hard drive serial numbers. These scanners work great for that. And we didn't have do any setup. Just plug them into your computer and they work. However, you can fine-tune the scanning or change other options. There's an config booklet in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I liked it at first but it is not as accurate as a Symbol bar code reader. Not very happy with it overall. I need it to read one type of tag 99% of the time and it struggles, my Symbol reader takes it at the first scan, this one take 5-10 times. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JMKE

customer_reviews.title: Great value -- gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive barcode scanner gets the job done -- and the price is right. I've only had it for a few weeks, but so far, it's been perfect. I purchased it in order to catalog my (physical) book library, and it got the job done quickly. (Note, it just scans the barcodes, you need something else to actually do the cataloging.) Like most barcode scanners, you configure it by scanning barcodes. I reduced the beep volume to low, as the default was a bit loud.
customer_reviews.author: R5T

customer_reviews.title: It Doesn't Function With PDF417 nor QR codes
customer_reviews.text: This product arrive quick and cheap for $21. I plug it into the computer. Hopefully, I naturally thought this would speed up process to scan barcodes. It doesn't work with PDF417. I had to return this product. Not worth the money if you have scan PDF417 or QR codes.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Montana

customer_reviews.title: stopped working within one month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my business and it worked for one month, and then stopped working. Very disappointed with the product and will be going back to the old one that i used to purchase
customer_reviews.author: Komi

customer_reviews.title: Fun, easy, reasonably priced AND effective !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wondrous. I'm shocked nowadays to find anything that works right out of the box and without drama, let alone something so reasonably priced! This is both fast and accurate. I've tried it so far both in a book inventory spreadsheet I'm building, and a couple of book seller sites, to check current value. (Just make sure you click in the field where you want the isbn number to show up.) It's also kind of fun to use, though ask me again after I've scanned several hundred books on my shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Whyte

customer_reviews.title: Tech Support was great!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a scanner to work in our school library. This scanner was within our budget, so I gave it a try. It worked with two of our barcodes, but not a third. After reading the manual and coming up short, I emailed WoneNice and asked for help. They responded within 24 hours and sent me step by step instructions to set the scanner to work with my bar codes. So far so good! I am impressed with the quick response time and most of all the price for their scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Stopped working only after a few uses, seller very responsive
customer_reviews.text: Scanner is no longer working and there's no support for it anywhere. UPDATE: I contacted the seller, even though the return window had passed, they were very responsive and got back to me right away and fixed the problem. I will purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Evette Galicia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Only used for a few minutes
customer_reviews.text: Simplicity and the way Plug and Play should always work! Recognized immediately. I launched Notepad (Windows app) and then scanned an ISBM barcode. BANG. Done it placed it right where the mouse pointer/cursor was positioned. Perfect. Only used for a few minutes, hope it is reliable and lasts several years. I recommend to anyone needing a barcode scanned for general use.
customer_reviews.author: a2zllc

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Functioning
customer_reviews.text: Often, I have to press the trigger 4 or 5 times before it'll function. I am not happy with the product at all.
customer_reviews.author: cullinan18

customer_reviews.title: Great little barcode scanner
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews on this barcode scanner I thought I'd give it a try, especially for the price. Another viewer stated that they use it for their dvd collection and itrackmine.com. I was skeptical at first but I have to say that it truly was a plug and play for me on my laptop. Works great to scan my dvds and anything else with a barcode! I also took it to work and created an inventory spreadsheet to inventory all of our liquor. Once doing the initial scans and filling in the names it's easy to use for the next inventory.
customer_reviews.author: IM

customer_reviews.title: They have special removable USB cables which was the problem I contacted the seller who was great. They immediately shipped a new cable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these on June 2017 and after 5 weeks one stopped working. They have special removable USB cables which was the problem I contacted the seller who was great. They immediately shipped a new cable. About 2 months after that, the cable on the other scanner also failed. The seller replaced that one too. The scanners work great but the cables obviously have a problem. Will probably not order this model again.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a simple barcode scanner this one works just fine. I use it to scan books for my personal library. Typing in the ISBNs became a chore so this scanner is perfect for the job. It reads the codes quickly and places same in my book catalogue program. Although the cord gets in the way, I can deal with it. A nice scanner for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great on my Mac for scanning UPC codes.
customer_reviews.text: Needed an easier way to list my DVD movies on eBay. By scanning the bar codes on the back saved me some time versus manually entering them. Scanner worked great, not setup required just plugin and play with Mac computer. I should have bought one of these long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Decent of occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Great for development. Ive used this scanner for development/testing a module of software that requires barcodes, and it seems fine. If you need something for daily consumer use you might want to spend a few extra dollars. This scanner can be slow to pickup and read barcodes.
customer_reviews.author: shudonz

customer_reviews.title: Never worked well, totally broken after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: This scanner always seemed a little slow and often required a few tires to scan a barcode, definitely did not work as well as the scanner we were replacing. After about 3 months (and just after the return window closed) the scanner totally quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Sockeye Cycle

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, accurate, & easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We have to inventory all of our stuff by serial number/barcode before we move, incase it gets stolen while being shipped. This thing made it all so much easier! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a classroom scanner for my library. I had to unplug and plug it back in after almost every other books. When it scanned properly then it was great but it had a hard time scanning items. Bummed it wasn't better!
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 2 months then stopped. Has a huge delay now, and I can't find any manuals online for a product reset code.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: They don’t scan all the time and can barely stay on stand correctly
customer_reviews.author: BossMum

customer_reviews.title: Strange product
customer_reviews.text: It just stays on once it's plugged in, there is no way to shut it off. Why have a button on it then? Probably will break in 2 days if the lazer can't be shut off.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny K

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for inventory. I work in IT and the amount of time this saves me is worth every penny. It will also avoid typo mistakes when gathering serial numbers
customer_reviews.author: TMH

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working won’t read 8s I’d like to return it but I can’t
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great but rattles excessively!
customer_reviews.text: The functionality is great, works perfectly for scanning barcodes into a computer. My complaint is that it rattles so loudly and excessively. We use it at work and have to keep it unplugged when we're not using it because the noise is so annoying.
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Just works, mac and windows are supported, very easy to configure
customer_reviews.text: Just works, mac and windows are supported, very easy to configure. I wish it supported reading codes from mobile devices, but you need a more expensive version for that.If your customers sometimes bring coupons on their phones, it is a needed feature. Otherwise this one is enough.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: The scanner worked fine for the first two weeks after that it wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: The scanner worked fine for the first two weeks after that it wasn't able to read codes as easy as other scanners. For example, if the code is on reflective surface or not flat, you will have difficulties scanning it. It's also tricky to scan any code and need to maintain the distance of the scanner from the barcode. My overall experience with this product is not good and you don't need it if efficiency important to you, otherwise it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never was 100% but after two weeks almost unusable.
customer_reviews.text: I've wasted more time staring at barcodes with this in hand, trying to scan a barcode. I've resorted to manually typing it in, which is exactly what I was trying to avoid with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for inventorying barcode tagged equipment. It worked exactly as required, however, the instructions are lacking, you just have to figure out to use the barcode sheet to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Dudley Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Product works fairly well does not scan and shiny barcodes though
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: I don't normally do reviews unless I absolutely love or dislike something
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally do reviews unless I absolutely love or dislike something. This is definately a dislike product. It is not good for shiny barcodes. Any barcodes in color other than black and white. And not good for small barcodes. It is not worth the money you save.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It been working for me and I'm just totally in love with it
customer_reviews.text: It was unexpected but when I first ordered this product, due to the price, I expected to get something very cheap and light weight. I would have never guessed that this product would be so amazingly solid! It been working for me and I'm just totally in love with it! It's been saving me tons of time, and that's just priceless. Thank you for such an amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: Kuoa L.

customer_reviews.title: ... means that misplacing the cable will render the device useless. Takes a bit of time to "wake up" ...
customer_reviews.text: The cable is unique -- USB to RJ-45 -- which means that misplacing the cable will render the device useless. Takes a bit of time to "wake up" when connected to a PC, usually a few clicks of the device button. For the price, a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Dad

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I hate getting tech stuff because I can’t ever figure it out. Not this scanner however. So easy to install and use just snap it in and go! Working great!
customer_reviews.author: Mary C.

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this is so easy to use literally plug and play. Its a great value for the $ I highly recommend if you are looking for a wired one.
customer_reviews.author: shelley

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a second scanner for my library. It is very easy to use. I use Follett Destiny and GoGuardian and all I had to do was plug it in to my computer. It scans Chromebooks and our book barcodes without any issues. It works just as well as the 200.00 scanner that we have in the library.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Works Straight Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: I am using this barcode scanner on both Windows 10 and Raspberry Pi OS successfully. When you first connect to Windows 10 , there is an automatic set up. Raspberry Pi is plug and play. Unit does come with a small manual to activate various settings, should you require.
customer_reviews.author: StrappySandal

customer_reviews.title: Works well and a great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is any easy way to put bar codes into any system with a USB. Click on the text box, scan the bar, and there ya go.
customer_reviews.author: 1995Wrangler

customer_reviews.title: It didn't do what we needed. It might be fine for others though.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't do what we needed. It might be fine for others though.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Daughtry

customer_reviews.title: Works well in Windows, and the price is right
customer_reviews.text: This scanner works well for Windows, and Chromebook, but it is hit or miss on Linux and hand held devices. Works well on my Windows tablet as well, No luck yet on the Raspberry Pi, which is what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: JohnsterTX

customer_reviews.title: Incompatibility with laptop
customer_reviews.text: Even with help, I can't get this thing to work with my Mac. If you take it as a return, I'll assume that the problem is on my end. Deal?
customer_reviews.author: Philip Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us and saved lots of time!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! We had 1000s of books and comics to enter and this was a life saver versus typing in titles or ISBN numbers or bar codes. I just wish there was some kind of handy stand to place it in so that you could just wave a book below it and have it scan automatically. There may be a generic one, I just couldn't find one specifically for this one. Just make sure you don't lose the directions since it is filled with bar codes that you have to scan in order to change the various options of the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: JasonSarah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use no drivers to install plugged up into USB with a Windows 10 based machine worked right away was using it within 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Scanner works from the get-go, service team responds quickly to questions
customer_reviews.text: This scanner recognizes multiple scan types right out of the box. I had trouble with the scanner adding a check digit to a Code39 scan and didn't see any way to turn it off in the literature. I emailed the service address and got my answer within two days (had three exchanges to verify what I needed and proof of purchase, even!). I had a good experience all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Christie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my application
customer_reviews.text: It works and is as advertised. It is a low end scanner, built inexpensively and this one was perfect for a project that was low budget. At this price if it breaks, I will toss it and just buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Imaxinar DM

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I really like this scanner. We had a different model (cheaper) that lasted about a year. I like the feel of this one. Feels much more expensive and hardy. Scans well.
customer_reviews.author: Motivate Science

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple barcode scanner for Dell Service Tags and this device works well! You can change the volume on it and it comes with a data editing (tab, carriage return, etc) booklet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing and easy.
customer_reviews.text: What a joy not typing in wrong passwords. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeeclub

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage - cant scan a single barcode
customer_reviews.text: I opened the boxing and tried to scan a few barcodes. The light never turns on to scan the barcodes. This item isnt even worth a penny. Now I need to waste my time to try to return a $20 piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike E

customer_reviews.title: It does not support installing scan mode
customer_reviews.text: It does not support installing scan mode , so it is not good
customer_reviews.author: burhan

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to setup with no fuss and work great. Quality appeared to be fine for this price but I can't speak about longevity, as I only used it for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Private Joker

customer_reviews.title: These are the best scanners at this low price
customer_reviews.text: I started using scanners that were 5x as expensive that were not as good as these scanners. Great Product for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an older scanner. It has the same problem. Sometimes it will scan and sometimes it won't. It's frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Baylee S.

customer_reviews.title: Valuable tool
customer_reviews.text: This handheld scanner is easy to set up and easy to use. No more squinting to see the UPC codes on products. Just scan the UPC code and it automatically populates into what I'm working on or does a product search in various platforms. Great price, great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene DeMet

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly and worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Prompt arrival and was easy to use: plug in and scan. It correctly scanned the barcode number into a variety of input boxes in my databases and websites.
customer_reviews.author: BAD SCOT

customer_reviews.title: Broken part in new scanner
customer_reviews.text: The product DO NOT scan any bar code label. When I connect it to the laptop, I here a rotate sound. and when I looked in to the scanner I saw a part that look half broken attached, picture of the part. Since I purchased 3 years office protection, please advise how can I get new part. Dan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy for Any IT Professional
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner. Bought this for work and hasn't let me down yet. I work in the IT field and i use this weekly to scan in serial numbers of equipment. I plugged it in my laptop, the driver loaded and i have been scanning away into excel spreadsheets ever since.
customer_reviews.author: ben lassiter

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This has been working well so far. Quite happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: N. W-D

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This lasted only about a year. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyTransplant

customer_reviews.title: This basically acts like another keyboard and encodes the barcode into a character ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked instantly. This basically acts like another keyboard and encodes the barcode into a character stream. Don't loose the instructions however - they are used to change the settings.
customer_reviews.author: z

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Scanner works as good as others I have purchase but at a better price.
customer_reviews.author: 1allied

customer_reviews.title: Works great, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Plugged it in, and got to work with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Works well, hard to beat for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to set up, comes with printed programming guide. Does not read barcodes on the bottom of a shiny metal Mac but all others I have tried worked. One quirk is that it doesn't work if you hold it too close or right upon the barcode, it doesn't scan, but you can move up 4-5 inches from the surface and it will.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Brown

customer_reviews.title: No longer works after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this barcode scanner for less than 6 months and it no longer scans. When I connect it to a computer with the USB connector it makes a triple beep, but then it cannot scan. No red bar at all. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Maryellen

customer_reviews.title: Good value works great
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest one on here but works great, will be another one.
customer_reviews.author: Russ1

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: it is very easy to use. It can scan barcodes easily.
customer_reviews.author: Captain X

customer_reviews.title: As a 35+ year I/T professional I had doubts about such a low-cost gun.  Wow am I impressed.  I'll be buying more when we go live
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in and it worked. All I had to do was scan in the code out of the booklet included with the gun to set it to automatically generate a TAB after the scan. I will be buying more of these when we go into production.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The device itself reads certain barcodes fine but the band is too narrow and will not ...
customer_reviews.text: The device itself reads certain barcodes fine but the band is too narrow and will not read smaller codes unless scanned at a specific angle. The price is right and if you have thick barcodes this will probably work for you but if you use anything 1cm or shorter it wont read properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sam N.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and very fast scanner
customer_reviews.text: What a great product, Makes scanning a breeze, is very accurate and a huge time saver. Love it and glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price, the quality is much higher than I expected because of the price. I bought this to do IT inventory, the laser was unable to read some serial number barcodes on laptops and printers but did a fantastic job for the price, it made my life much easier.
customer_reviews.author: eMCEee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely made barcode scanner, can't beat the price and the features. Worked right after plugging it in. WoneNice tech support was very helpful and quick with adding a custom prefix and suffix.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: This made my job so much easier, taking inventory of computer equipment. My company said 2-3 months to get one and 200 bucks.......Plug in, scan... it's accurate. Love it
customer_reviews.author: DAN E. TURNER

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for a while and it has worked as advertised. It has made inventorying my stuff a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Scanner is Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this product. Purchased 4 but only 1 worked. Received refund for only 1.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Think about how you can use this for tasks you may not have considered...read on
customer_reviews.text: If you have anything that has a bar code for office work, data entry, invoicing, plugging dates into a computer etc use this. You can make your own barcodes with online programs. Think about how you can make your work faster and more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to enter my books into a free online library program. It's easy to use and I've lent it out.
customer_reviews.author: trekshel

customer_reviews.title: This is because osx sucks.
customer_reviews.text: plug n play keyboard. no drivers needed. on osx you can copy a existing keyboard plist and just change the vendor id and it will work, This is because osx sucks.
customer_reviews.author: batman

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Nice cheap Barcode scanner. It does not have an auto scan feature, nor does it have sound options, but for at home use, this thing can't be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Wow, 5 stars bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is small and light, fits in my computer bag and I don't notice the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Barron Sampson

product_meta.title: WoneNice USB Laser Barcode Scanner Wired Handheld Bar Code Scanner Reader Black
product_meta.description:
*Plug and play, read all the standard 1D bar codes 

*Handheld type barcode scanner is with USB port cable, LED and buzzer indicator. 

*Very comfortable operation sense, Intelligent AGC control, Rich decoded types. 

Work with all versions of Windows, Mac and Linux 

Works with Quickbook, Word, Excel, Novell, and all common software 

No software needed, it's plug and play USB barcode scanner that can read all the standard 1D bar codes like 1D UPS, USPS, FedEx, DHL, BOOK barcode. 

Laser USB barcode scanner with improved accuracy, scanning accuracy can be up 30%, scanning rate: 200 times per second. 

*Safty performance: According with national level 2 laser safty standars 
Description: 
*Operational Light Source:Visible 650-670nm 

*Depth of Field:0-600mm(0.33mm.PCS90%) 

*Reading Distance:2.5-600mm(100% UPC/EAN) 

*Print Contrast:30% min 

*Scan Scope:10mm-250mm 

Package Contents : 

*1 x Barcode Scanner 

*1 x USB Cable 

*1 x User Manual
feature_bullets: Plug and play, This laser handheld barcode scanner has simple installation with any USB port and Ideal for businesses, shops and warehouse operations. Its function is unbeatable and easy to use, design is stylish
Compatible with Windows, Mac, and Linux; works with Word, Excel, Novell, and all common software
Scanning Speed: 200 scans per second. Scanning angle: Inclination angle 55°, Elevation angle 65°. Operational Light Source:Visible Laser 650-670nm.

Decode Capability: Code11, Code39, Code93, Code32, Code128, Coda Bar, UPC-A, UPC-E, EAN-8, EAN-13, JAN.EAN/UPC Add-on2/5 MSI/Plessey, Telepen and China Postal Code,Interleaved 2 of 5, Industrial 2 of 5, Matrix 2 of 5 ; 300 configurable options for prefix, suffix and termination strings
Color: Black. Dimensions: 3.6 x 2.6 x 6.1 inches. Type of Cable: 2M or 6ft straight cable. Shock: 1.5m drop on concrete surface. Regulatory Approvals: FCC CE.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars684 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
